page.title: 08FORESTRY
page.content: Monoughty Forest was one of the first areas to be planted in Scotland by the Forestry Commission. The Commission was set up in 1919 and its very first tree was planted here.Unfortunately it was chopped down recently. The forest has 700 hectares of trees and in one hectare 2,500 trees are planted.5,000 tonnes of timber are felled each year.Trees are felled when they are about 60 years old.An angle of 45'is cut at one side and at the opposite side they saw inwards towards the cut.When they fell downhill they always keep a row of trees along the bottom.2,000 trees are used each year for telegraph poles.A man from British Telecom comes and measures out the length of the poles. Young trees are planted about 1 metre apart.
